title: Mac OS X EL Capitan
body:
Since I updated to El capitan 10.11 I cant seem to change my resolution to fit right anymore, it's recommended to be at 1920x1080 but i was lagging and having low fps. So i lowered it to 1600x900, Then I updated it and now when i go back to 1920x1080 the screen is squished limiting my view topside....
Any suggestions???

replies.body: Hmm...Can you send a screenshot of what this looks like as well as a picture of your Video settings in-game? ([This](http://i.imgur.com/nIejfLg.jpg) screen).

> [{quoted}](name=RiotBok,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Prex1u9m,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-06-01T22:48:30.775+0000)
>
> Hmm...Can you send a screenshot of what this looks like as well as a picture of your Video settings in-game? ([This](http://i.imgur.com/nIejfLg.jpg) screen).

Yeah here you go sorry about the wait i totally forgot about this till i tried changing the resolution again.

([this](http://i.imgur.com/gpgNVKP.png)one)

From your screenshot, it looks like your resolution is set at 1680x1050 instead of 1920x1080. I'm not sure if that was intentional, but that's going to give you a bit of a different look.  Are you running into issues with your new resolution as well?

> [{quoted}](name=RiotBok,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Prex1u9m,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-29T20:43:28.023+0000)
>
> From your screenshot, it looks like your resolution is set at 1680x1050 instead of 1920x1080. I'm not sure if that was intentional, but that's going to give you a bit of a different look.  Are you running into issues with your new resolution as well?

Well currently no, but like i was saying before, I had it set to 1920x1080 before I updated to El Capitan. Then after the update i noticed lower frames and lag or what not so i thought if i lowered the resolution to 1680x1050 then maybe it would perform better? Not too sure why i did that though, anyways when I try and go back to 1920x1080 it gives me a border and I can't scroll up on the map... Any suggestions? Also thank you for responding.
